poem:
**Time in a Toybox**

A ship sails  
upon the carpet sea,  
small hands navigate  
beyond the stars,  
a stethoscope loops  
around the universe,  
plastic pieces  
strewn like confetti,  
each a realm  
where dreams unfurl,  
whirlwind worlds  
on living room floors—  
with laughter,  
they invent  
the morning anew.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "The best UK Christmas gifts for five-year-olds: 12 road-tested toys they’ll play with every day A pirate, astronaut, doctor, and a whirlwind of emotions – a five-year-old can be all of these before lunchtime. At this age, “play” isn’t just fun; it’s a crucial part of their development. This is why finding toys that can keep up with their huge imaginations – and draw them back for repeat play – is no mean feat. The". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
